title: Cross-spectral purity as a sign of spatiotemporal separability
abstract:
We study the connection between cross-spectral purity and spatiotemporal
separability of nonstationary (pulsed) scalar fields. It is found that in the
case of complete coherence, there is a two-way relation between global
cross-spectral purity and spatiotemporal separability. In other words, a
coherent scalar field that satisfies Mandel's purity condition across the whole
wavefront is spatiotemporally separable, and vice versa. In the case of partial
coherence, the relation is not as clear, and completely breaks down for
incoherent fields. We briefly discuss simple linear measurement methods that
can reveal cross-spectral purity.
